title: Boris Johnson brands US 'absolutely ruthless' for safeguarding intelligent agent's wife
text:
Boris Johnson has branded the US "absolutely ruthless" in its safeguarding of an intelligence agent’s wife alleged to have killed a British teenager.

The Prime Minister said America was “very reluctant” to allow its citizens to be tried overseas and would vehemently enforce the code of diplomatic immunity, despite protestations that it had not been used appropriately.

It came as the parents of Harry Dunn prepared to travel to New York on Sunday, in a bid to heap pressure on Donald Trump.

The family has begged the US President to allow Anne Sacoolas, 42, to be formally questioned about the crash, which occurred when she was driving on the wrong side of the road outside RAF Croughton in Northamptonshire, a base used by the US intelligence services.

Mrs Sacoolas, a mother of three, fled the UK just days after the accident under the protection of diplomatic immunity and the US has indicated she will not return.

Mr Dunn’s parents, Charlotte Charles and Tim Dunn, said they were travelling to the US to continue their fight for justice.
description: Boris Johnson has branded the US "absolutely ruthless" in its safeguarding of an intelligence agent’s wife alleged to have killed a British teenager.
